text: Bottle. Hazy light pink liquid with small to medium white head. Aroma of raspberries, lemon, red apples, light wood, cinnamon and light grain. Taste is dry and light to medium sour with notes of lemon, raspberries, light grain and red apples. Medium bodied with medium carbonation. Nice!

750, capped. Thanks, N! What an awesome treat. Pours a clear medium pinkish purple with minimal filmy head. Big tangy nose, showing tons of fresh raspberry and a bit of lemon zest. The more fruit sours you try, the less you want to age any of them, because the fresh fruit character is always the best part. This is just explosively juicy and dripping with berry character, and I dont think it was even the most recent release from these guys. Creamy medium body, acidic bite, moderate carb. Sharp attack, showing lots of berries and a bit of lemon zest along with a piercing acidity. Long tangy lightly-bitey finish.
Bottle. Ruby orange pour with white head. Raspberry, fruit, oak, tart aromas. Raspberries, tart and sweet, light oak and sour Flavors.
Bottle. Pours deep red with a thin pinkish white lace. Aroma shows lots of raspberry, tartness, funk. Flavor is similar-gets better as it warms a bit.

Bottle at home with friends. Pour is murky purple-pink with a small white head and decent lacing. Super pungent, tangy, sulphuric, huge fruit pit, raspberry skins, oak, and blueberries in the aroma. Taste is big jam, raspberries, salty, some blueberries, grapey, tangy, and acidic with a huge sour finish - my god that is sour. Full mouthfeel with high carbonation. Way too sour for my liking.
Another wickedly crafted DG beer. So juicy. Perfectly sour. Raspberry goodness. So drinkable.
Bottle at Dangerous Bottleshares WHLZBRZ edition. Deep red pour with a pinkish head. Jammy raspberries, light funk, some yoghurt lactic notes and some straw.

Bottle @ Dangerous Bottleshares WLZBRZ edition. Thats right. Yet another De Garde is about to enter my mouth. Pours dark red with a white/pink head. Aroma has that classic de grade tartness - oh so good. BOMB of raspberries with all the flesh and seed. Also some jam, fruit yogurt and weak gummy bears. The taste has some weak vinegar, some funk, a ton of raspberries, yogurt and slight vinous notes. So refreshing even though it is very sour and has a slight burn to it in the end. A straw would be fine!

750ml bottle enjoyed @ Dangerous Bottleshares - WLZBRZ edition. Pours beautiful hazy ruby red with a pinkish head. Aroma is raspberries and plenty of them! tart, overripe fruits, oak and funk. Flavour is tart and light sweet. Medium bodied, kiwi-like feeling in the mouth, fizzy carbonation. Finish is dry, tart and easy drinking.

Bottle @ Dangerous Bottleshares WLZBRZ-edition. Pours hazy deep and milky red with a big pink head. Aromas of raspberries, lactic tart, oaky, classic de garde funk, dry vinous notes. Taste is basically a dry, lactic, raspberry yoghurt with a lot of raspberry pits and a vinous oaky dry finish.
Bottle. Reddish pink color. NO head. Raspberries and Apple sourness in the aroma. Sour flavor with loads of raspberries. Dry, only some remaining sugars from the fruit. Lovely!

Bottle thanks to Aaron at Dangerous Bottleshares WLZBRZ edition. Gushing like shizzle. Pours a murky, ruby red with a huuge pink head. Aroma has lovely tart, lactic raspberries, vanilla, oak, funk, extremely jammy, kiwi, overripe sweet raspberries. Taste is really sour, fresh, sparkling, looots of raspberry, dry oaky vinous finish. Just crazy nice raspberry complexity! Really high carb and juicy, crisp body.
Bottle: Poured a pink to ruby color with a white head. Aroma is very raspberry. Super tart raspberry flavor, but drinkable.
750ml bottle. Huge raspberry aroma, flavor is super sour raspberry, really is nothing like a berliner but it is a nice brew.

Bottle @ RBSG 2015. Thanks for sharing, Doug. Blood red pour with some pink foam. Grass and fruit skin nose. Some seedy fruit jam, green apples, and lemons. Intense sourness to this one. Big time lemon juice and green apples. Some Jolly Rancher, a little bit of fresh berry, and some grass. Light woodiness and some red wine vinegar, too.

Bottle at the RBSG grand tasting in Portland 
Hazy red with a small pink head, some lacing. Aroma of raspberries. Taste of raspberries, sweet and tart  
Nice, desert in a glass

22 oz. bottle, pours a cloudy pinkish red with a small pink head. Nose screams out pithy raspberries and medium tartness - very jammy. Flavour is along the same lines, with shitloads of jammy raspberries, medium tartness and a little pithy character. So fruity and jammy. Wonderful stuff.

Another fascinating beer from the RBSG Grand Tasting. Poured purple with a pink head. Nose of raspberry. Medium body. A lively and adventurous mouth feel. Flavor is full of fruit and lots and lots of raspberry. Finish shows some tartness. This is simply delicious.

Bottle from Douglas. Thanks!

A: Purple color, pink head.

N: Big raspberry, some cherry, vinegar, light funk, some green olive. Lemon and grapefruit rind.

T: Tart, light sweetness.

M: Light body, crisp carbonation, no alcohol.

O: Solid. Another fine De Garde beer.
22oz bottle pours out a muddy pink ruby topped with a pink head. Nose is raspberries strawberries sweetness tart and some funk. Taste is more of therraspberry jam sweetness tart pucker notes.
Bottle. Pours a bright purple color with a large white head. A big sweet raspberry nose. The flavor is big sweet raspberry, woody, light but flavorful. Awesome.

Bottle, thanks to p1meatloaf. Pours neon pink with a large pink head that dissipates quickly to a small residual with some lacing. Aroma is fresh picked rasperries still in the field, along with a lemony sour mash. Flavor follows, medium tart and very fruity, tons of raspberry. I honestly would not even notice a barrel character without reading it in the description; the berries are just too fresh for that. Lightish body, high carbonation. Yummy.

Bottle thanks to Chow. Pours a cloudy purple with medium pinkish head that lasts. The aroma is strong raspberry and light funk. Medium mouth, nice jammy raspberry and nice sourness, really enjoyed this one.

Poured from bottle to Glass. Blood red hue with creamy red head that settled. Aroma is lactic, raspberry, straw, jammy, vinous. Mouthfeel is great with medium light body and zesty carbonation. Taste is dry sweetness with a tartness throughout. Overall this is a fantastic brew.
Bottle..Pour is red with a bubbly head..Nose is juicy raspberries, funk, tart, berries...Taste is light raspberries, funk, oak, dry, soft yogurt..

[2/28/15] Draught at De Garde Brewing in Tillamook. Release and bottle share event. As Imperial Raz Bu. Dark red color with a huge pink head. Huge berries aroma, lacto, funk. Sourish, lactic and funky flavor with huge berries. Medium-bodied.
Bottle at Seattle Share. Juicy red, small white foam. huge raspberry, lovely juicy. Huge tart, lovely big tart and spiced raspberry. Medium juicy body. Some berliner weiss character.

Bottle pour at a tasting, listed as imperial raz bu. Pours a super pink purple color with a raspberry explosion aroma. Wonderfully tart raspberry flavor. Lingering sweet and sour cherry and berry flavor. Incredible beer. Loved this beer.

Bottle shared by Pruf, originally picked up by DSG. Dark pink close to purple color. Cannot see through it, head fades quickly. Aroma is raspberry sorbet. Awesome aroma. Flavor has great tartness. Very dry, spritzy with a very drying finish. My mouth needs water without the beer being acetic. Fruit is present but tart raspberry rules. Natural, fun, tart, refreshing, yup that is what I want from an imperial raspberry tart beer.
user_location: HdG (past: NYC, KS, Rain City), Maryland, USA

text: Bottle, listed as imperial raz bu (5.4%), with thanks to DSG. Pours ridiculously pretty purple/red juice with pink juicy head. Aroma: raspberries. Is there anything else? Probably, but why force the matter. Raspberries. Tart, juicy, fruity. Sweetened cereal at the end. Soft wheaty lacto goodness, with a huge dose of fresh raspberries. Im loving this. Totally falls into the "carbonated juice masquerading as a beer" category, but I like that category. New style?
Draft - Tart and sweet raspberry jam. Purple red with a thin frothy head. Raspberry jam through and through. A bit to jammy, but so fruity and well done.

[ Bottle ][ ½ of 75cl ][ Tasting ][ Trade ][ Snifter ][ 9.24.14 ]Hazy blood, puffy white head fizzes out quickly. Ultra seedy nose, singular raspberry sourness, light citric notes but very focused. Sweeter profile, tons of raspberry sugar early before heavy citric acid mid, light chest burn and citric sourness, full body carbonation accents arsenic, gritty body clings through the hot acetic end. Singular but very expressive and rich, the fruit expressive here.[ 9.24 Tasting Ranking ]01. Sante Adairius Cask Strawberry02. Russian River FfaC 201303. De Garde Imperial Raspberry Bu04. De Garde Raspberry Bu 05. Dieu du Ciel dete aux Framboise06. Night Shift Cape Codder Weisse07. Night Shift Ever Weisse08. Firestone Walker Bretta Rose 09. Crooked Stave Raspberry Dark Origins10. Almanac Dogpatch Strawberry11. Night Shift Somer Weisse12. 1809 Berliner Weisse13. De Garde Imperial Strawberry Bu14. Firestone Walker Bretta Weisse

Pour is a deep opaque red with a white head and pink hue. Nose is extremely rich and seedy raspberry, almost pie like, with a touch of creamy lactic acid in back. Taste is similar, lots of seedy raspberry, very rich flavors, fairly tart, lacto towards the back of the palate. Creamy light body, moderate carbonation, dry finish, gets a bit acetic and acidic hot in the back.

750ml bottle pours dark red pink with a finger of head. Nose is huge bursting juicy tart raspberry jam, some subtle barn funk on the long inhale, wood. Taste is smashed raspberry jam bomb with crisp acidity that cuts through the jammy fruit to create a nice lively palate with a more restrained barnyard woody funk than other DG bottles. Finish is crisp tart berry, semi sweet jam notes mixed with dry dusty barn rafters and old weathered wood. This is delicious.

At my place with Taylor, Justin, Kristen, and Matt. Pours neon red, lacing. Aroma is nice beautiful floral roses, tart. Taste is lightly sweet, awesome raspberry, big jammy, light acidity, nice authentic fruit.
Bottle at Nicks tasting. Pours pink grapefruit. No head. Nose/taste of fresh as hell raspberry, raspberry pit, funky acid and funky sour wheat with oak. Lighter medium body.

750 ml bottle to snifter (BIG thanks to Dogbones for sharing this!). Looks good; a hazy raspberry red with foamy pink head and some light sediment. Smells good too; tart and fruity. Tastes like it smells with a pleasantly lively mouthfeel. Great beer!

20th February 2014Fare thee well Josh tasting at Bruces. Thanks to Bruce again! Hazy orange - red beer, small pink head. Mild rasberry snout. Palate is light, crispy and a little dry. Light fresh raspberry and tart sherbet. Finishes light and crisp. Refreshing is somewhat one note.

Bottle shared in London for my farewell drinks. Cheers to Bruce for this one. Pours clear red with a small white cap on top. Nose is super tangy and tarty red berries, quite ripe and has that grapefruit sour tang to finish it off. Nose is raspberry atrt, a touch sugary, lemon curd, lime juice, and a little plummy. Full of ripe raspberry focus throughout and nice tartiness. Balances well. Good stuff

Bottle shared at Joshs Farewell Hoorah - big thanks to Bruce my OR beer pedler, 20/02/14. 
Lightly hazed cherry red with a good sized crimson covering that soon dissipates.
Nose is tangy berry fruit medley, tarte raspberry, faint smoke, bitter fruit mash.
Taste comprises sharp raspberry, light blueberry friends in the mix, straw, light smoke, sherbet berry dabs.
Medium bodied, fine carbonation with light spritz keeping it an easy drinker.
Solid Berliner, solid De Garde once again!
user_location: Hazlemere, the lower Xhitlerns, Buckinghamshire, ENGLAND

text: Bottle, big thanks to Bruce. It pours clear red with a minimal white head. The nose is sweet raspberry, candy, barnyard, funk, light manure and assorted zoo smells. The taste is crisp, tart, raspberry, sherbet, mild acidity, Granny Smith apple, barnyard and some graininess in the background with a dry, tart finish. Medium body and prickly carbonation. More body than the blu blu which is definitely an improvement. Crisp, tart and damn delicious. Very nice.

Bottle shared in London during Joshs going away do. Big thanks to Bruce for this one. Pours a lovely, clearish pink with a light pink foam head. Big, juicy raspberry aroma, suggestions of berry tartness. Light-medium sweet flavor with rich raspberries, hints of raspberry pit bitterness, jammy berries, suggestions of poopy barnyard, mild acidity. Medium bodied with fine, massaging carbonation. Pretty clean to finish, buckets of tart raspberries, light berry preserves, subtle funk, cleansing acidity. Lovely beer.

Bottle from Daniel. Aroma was raspberry and yogurt tones, which carried over into the flavors. These all are quite similar, except for fruit integration. Overpowering notes of mostly tart raspberry with a great palate. Excellent beer.

Bottle... Poured deep pinkish red with a thin red. Nice ripe raspberry and sour aroma. Quite tart with loads of yeast and acuity. Really nice candied and yogurt-like raspberry tones. Mild funk and wood but mostly sour with berry flavors. One of the best I have had from De Garde.

Bottle shared by Don at Sloshfest. Pours deep pink to purple with a blue hue. Thin steady white head. Aroma is limy and super fresh raspberry juice. Taste reveals the disproportianate amounts of raspberry while it holds on to bits of typical wheat beer characteristics. Slight funk as well.
